recipe: Heat: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook until translucent, about 5 minutes.
Stir: Stir in the minced garlic, sliced carrots, and celery. Cook for another 5 minutes until the vegetables begin to soften.
Add: Add the chopped zucchini, diced potatoes, and cook for another 5 minutes.
Pour: Pour in the vegetable broth and the canned diced tomatoes with their juices. Stir in the chopped kale, bay leaf, and dried thyme.
Season: Season with salt and black pepper. Bring the soup to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for about 25-30 minutes, until the vegetables are tender.
Remove: Remove the bay leaf before serving. Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary.
Serve: Serve hot, garnished with fresh herbs if desired.
